column1:
Windsorlego,"2020-01-12T14:39:14.03Z","Hello Chick","

When I saw this set I knew that I was going to tinker with it.
column3: t anything special about the chick, done in the expected colours of yellow and orange. The flowers and greenery add some relief from the yellow.
round in the flowers and the lavender one went in the white flower and the bright light orange into the lavender flower.

column5: I thought they were rather clumsy and perhaps the designer had run out of steam?

column1: So........The feet start on Page 23 Section 22 of the instruction booklet.
column2: I used the tan crosses and on each one, as shown in booklet, I put a 1x2 orange brick topped with one 1x2 orange plate.&nbsp
column3: I then used six bright light orange plates with horizontal tooth (part no. 49668).&nbsp
column4: Three each of these were placed on the tan parts of the cross that were still visible, facing out to the front.

column1: That, for me, made the difference between a square toed chick and something that approached a real chick'
column3: Not quite sure why a tan 3x3 cross was chosen.&nbsp
column4: I would have thought a dark orange would have been more appropriate but maybe the cost&nbsp

column3: would have been nice but presumably again costs came into play here.

column1: If you are a Brickheadz fan this is a nice little set to add to your collection.
